docs.abstract: After the disastrous 2018 midterm elections, Republican women trying to right their political ship are focused on a special election in North Carolina.
docs.snippet: After the disastrous 2018 midterm elections, Republican women trying to right their political ship are focused on a special election in North Carolina.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — While House Democratic women celebrated one of their best elections ever last November, Republican women lamented one of their worst.

headline.main: ‘Bigger Than a Party of Old White Men’: G.O.P. Women Seek to Replenish House Ranks
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Women Seek to Regain House Seats. Obstacles Await.

docs.abstract: Democrats, hitting a presidential stonewall in their efforts to stoke public anger, believe that testimony from Robert S. Mueller III is the only way to clear up certain ambiguities in his report.
docs.snippet: Democrats, hitting a presidential stonewall in their efforts to stoke public anger, believe that testimony from Robert S. Mueller III is the only way to clear up certain ambiguities in his report.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Democrats, frustrated by President Trump’s efforts to stonewall their investigations and eager to stoke public anger about the president’s behavior, are pinning their diminishing hopes on Robert S. Mueller III yet again.

headline.main: Frustrated House Democrats Pin Their Hopes on Mueller
headline.print_headline: Testimony From Mueller Still Holds an Enticing Hope for the Democrats

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Glenn Thrush and Nicholas Fandos

docs.abstract: The service for the six-term Republican senator from Indiana, who died last month, had many of the trappings of a state funeral.
docs.snippet: The service for the six-term Republican senator from Indiana, who died last month, had many of the trappings of a state funeral.
docs.lead_paragraph: INDIANAPOLIS — Richard G. Lugar, a six-term senator from Indiana known for expertise in international affairs and a voice incapable of a shout or a slur, was remembered on Wednesday for qualities that are rarely seen in today’s Washington: thoughtful deliberation, willing compromise and relentless civility.

headline.main: Richard Lugar Is Remembered as a ‘True American Statesman’
headline.print_headline: Lugar Hailed As Statesman Who Made World Safer

docs.abstract: The pardon was the latest example of the president using a unilateral power of his office to absolve a prominent figure whose case personally resonates with him.
docs.snippet: The pardon was the latest example of the president using a unilateral power of his office to absolve a prominent figure whose case personally resonates with him.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Wednesday granted a full pardon to Conrad M. Black, the former press baron and onetime society fixture who was found guilty of fraud and obstruction of justice in 2007.

headline.main: President Trump Grants Pardon to Conrad Black
headline.print_headline: Trump Pardons an Ally Found  Guilty of Fraud and Obstruction

docs.abstract: Tom Udall, a veteran New Mexico Democrat, said he could do more to advance his progressive ideas by skipping another two years of relentless re-election fund-raising.
docs.snippet: Tom Udall, a veteran New Mexico Democrat, said he could do more to advance his progressive ideas by skipping another two years of relentless re-election fund-raising.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It is quite a testament to the current state of the Senate that a successful veteran lawmaker of two decades believes he can accomplish more by quitting than by trying to stick it out another six years.

headline.main: A Senator Wants to Have a Greater Impact. So He’s Leaving the Senate.
headline.print_headline: A Senator Says He’s Eager to Help the Country (as an Ex-Senator)

docs.abstract: In a directive, the president ordered the intelligence agencies to cooperate with the review and gave the attorney general the authority to unilaterally declassify their documents.
docs.snippet: In a directive, the president ordered the intelligence agencies to cooperate with the review and gave the attorney general the authority to unilaterally declassify their documents.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump took extraordinary steps on Thursday to give Attorney General William P. Barr sweeping new authorities to conduct a review into how the 2016 Trump campaign’s ties to Russia were investigated, significantly escalating the administration’s efforts to place those who investigated the campaign under scrutiny.

headline.main: Trump Gives Attorney General Sweeping Power in Review of 2016 Campaign Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Barr Given Broad Power to Review 2016 Campaign Inquiry

byline.original: By Maggie Haberman and Michael S. Schmidt

docs.abstract: President Trump, at a news conference with farmers and ranchers on Thursday, made misleading or false statements about agricultural data, union support of a renegotiated trade deal and his approval ratings.
docs.snippet: President Trump, at a news conference with farmers and ranchers on Thursday, made misleading or false statements about agricultural data, union support of a renegotiated trade deal and his approval ratings.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Agriculture Department's Economic Research Service recently forecast that net farm income would reach $69.4 billion in 2019, compared with $61.5 billion in 2016. Yet President Trump is omitting that farm income reached $75.2 billion in 2017, before falling to $63.1 billion in 2018.

headline.main: Fact-Checking Trump’s Claims on Agriculture, Trade and Poll Numbers

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: AMERICAN FEDERATION OF LABOR-CONGRESS OF INDUSTRIAL ORGANIZATIONS

docs.abstract: The president repeatedly sought to have Attorney General Jeff Sessions reopen the investigation into Mrs. Clinton’s use of a private email server.
docs.snippet: The president repeatedly sought to have Attorney General Jeff Sessions reopen the investigation into Mrs. Clinton’s use of a private email server.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Attorney General Jeff Sessions had a tenuous hold on his job when President Trump called him at home in the middle of 2017. The president had already blamed him for recusing himself from investigations related to the 2016 election, sought his resignation and belittled him in private and on Twitter.

headline.main: Mueller Report Reveals Trump’s Fixation on Targeting Hillary Clinton
headline.print_headline: Mueller Report Shows Trump’s Fixation on Using Power to Target a Rival

docs.abstract: While he once welcomed the report as “total exoneration,” the president in recent days has assailed it as a “total ‘hit job’” produced by “true Trump Haters.”
docs.snippet: While he once welcomed the report as “total exoneration,” the president in recent days has assailed it as a “total ‘hit job’” produced by “true Trump Haters.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The day after the special counsel delivered his report to the Justice Department, President Trump was ecstatic. He claimed vindication. When he walked into the dining room of his Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida, according to someone there, guests rose to their feet to give him a standing ovation.

headline.main: Victor or Victim? Trump’s Changing Response to Mueller Report
headline.print_headline: Reveling in ‘Total Exoneration,’ Seething About a ‘Total Hit Job’

docs.abstract: The number of civilian casualties investigated by the Defense Department is far lower than what watchdog groups have also reported.
docs.snippet: The number of civilian casualties investigated by the Defense Department is far lower than what watchdog groups have also reported.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The American military killed 120 civilians in strikes, raids and firefights across two continents in 2018, the Pentagon said Thursday — a far lower number than what watchdog groups have reported.

headline.main: U.S. Airstrikes and Raids Killed 120 Civilians in 2018, Pentagon Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Airstrikes and Raids Killed 120 Civilians in 2018, Pentagon Says
